items.title: [0.1] Move window with markers in PianoRoll
items.body: If marker moved to the window border, move window further

items.title: [0.1] Piano Roll doesn't react on clicks
[0.1] Loaded plugin is not restored, when reopen project
[0.1] Piano Roll window can be moved too far
items.body: Need to restrict max range for piano roll

items.title: [0.1] Reversed state restoring trouble
items.body:
1. Set reversed for sample
2. Close plugin
3. Reopen it
4. Reversed is not toggled
5. Add new sample
6. Return to first
7. Reversed state toggled

items.title: [0.1] With 2 or more samples there are some playback glitches
[0.1] Crash when click on pianoroll when all samples closed
items.body:
1. Add 1 or more samples
2. Close all of them
3. Click on pianoroll

items.title: [0.1] Reverse button works not on active sample
[0.1] Plugin crash when one sample longer than another
items.body:
1. Load 2 samples, with different length
2. When playback reach end of shortest sample, app crash

items.title: [0.1] Remove author name placeholders in about screen
[Feature] Don't change speed with changed pitch
[0.1] Sample start position is broken
items.body: If you change note start position it will have no effect at all

items.title: [0.1] Piano roll reacts bad to multiple playing sounds
items.body:
1. Try to play some fast changing notes, when some of them overlap each other
2. Piano roll doesn't keep up with changes

items.title: [0.1] Repeatable note playing issue
items.body: If you try to play some note repeatedly with small delay, you found that it cause some sound artifacts.

items.title: [0.1] Sample range is broken
items.body: For some reason, if you change right sample active region marker, it will stick to some point and you won't be able to change it to the right

items.title: [0.1] Keys on pianoroll don't turn off
items.body:
How to reproduce:

1. Press any key on pianoroll or play midi note
2. When note is off, key is still marked as active

items.title: missing #include <cassert>
items.body:
Error when compile under Linux with gcc 9.1.1

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. git clone Soompler
2. projucer --resave Soompler.jucer
3. make
4. 

> ../../Source/LinearPanel.cpp:76:5: error: ‘assert’ was not declared in this scope
>    76 |     assert(padding >= 0);
>       |     ^~~~~~
> ../../Source/LinearPanel.cpp:13:1: note: ‘assert’ is defined in header ‘<cassert>’; did you forget to ‘#include <cassert>’?
>    12 | #include "Settings.h"
>   +++ |+#include <cassert>
>    13 |


**Expected behavior**
compile


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OpenSUSE TW GCC 9.1.1
 - JUCE 5.4.4

adding #include <cassert> into Source/LinearPanel.cpp solves this issue

items.title: [0.0.5] Clicks when playing samples
items.body: Clicks are noticeable when new note begin to play

items.title: [0.0.5] Volume (and other knobs?) send wrong values to controller
items.body: Volume is very loud on low position and super-distorted on high. SoomplerKnob class is first one to blame.

items.title: [0.0.5] Plugin state doesn't restored after reopening project
items.body:
Steps to reproduce: 

1. work with plugin
2. close project
3. open project again
4. go to soompler instance
5. all gui state reset
